A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Warning: This review will contain spoilers.

My biggest gripe with this movie was the way in which they used Luke. The possibilities were endless\, especially given the lead up with his failure training Ben Solo\, his experiences with Vader and what hed learned from Obi-Wan and Yoda. A cautionary and ominous training session filled with warnings of the Dark Side would have not only enhanced the movie but Reys internal struggles and the stained past of the Jedi order. Instead we get scenes of Luke living like a hermit who has given up. And thats about it. Even when he agrees to train Rey\, its shown as one session and then he gives up because hes too scared to train her. 

In my view there were two ways the director could have used Luke: 1) as a legendary warrior coming out of hiding to save the resistance or 2) a wise Yoda-like master of the force who passed on his knowledge to Rey. As Ive discussed\, option 2 didnt happen. We almost\, almost got option 1 but alas it was simply an illusion. An illusion that drained Luke to the point of death. And we didnt even get a lightsaber dual this time the way we did in a New Hope. It was overall a failure and almost a bit insulting to the legend of Luke. 

The rest of the movie was equally disappointing but I will say Kylo Rens acting was superb and his character development quite good. If only wed gotten that with the other characters as well.
